The Oscars never fails to provide an unparalleled level of red carpet glamour. No where more so than with the hair and make-up looks.

"There are months and months of work that go behind these looks," Emma Stone's make-up artist and Nars Cosmetics director of pro artistry and red carpet, Rachel Goodwin tells The Telegraph. “It’s the biggest, most high-pressured day for women. The Oscars is the red carpet; it’s the one that everyone compares all the other ones to."

It's unsurprising then that the beauty looks often feel unattainable to us mere mortals. And yet, thanks to a rising numbers of experts taking to social media to share their tricks of the trade, it's become clear that some of the Oscar 2017 red carpet beauty tricks aren't as complicated as you'd think... 

The loose powder lip trick

Painting some brick lips on this goddess tonight. #emmastone you couldn't be more beautiful if you tried. Audacious Lipstick in Mona by NARS #narsissist #mua #beauty #oscars

A post shared by Rachel Goodwin (@rachel_goodwin) on Feb 26, 2017 at 6:12pm PST

While a statement lipstick might look good on the red carpet, celebrities often opt for a smoky eye instead so they don’t have to worry about the colour fading or smudging before the ceremony is over.

Goodwin had a solution for this dilemma when prepping Emma Stone's bold lip colour. “I layered Nars Audacious Lipstick in Mona, £25, blotted it with loose powder and then layered it again and then loose powder,” Goodwin told The Telegraph. “I did a combination of things to create a strong base for her lip colour because I wanted to make sure it didn’t fade at all.”

The £2.99 hair must-haves

❤ Because I so love a half up hair moment ❤ @dakotajohnson making my hair dreams come true yet again ❤ @scunci hairpins + @dove #ExtraHoldHairspray ❤ #HairdoOfTheDay #oscars #academyawards #MarksEyeView #MarksMuses

A post shared by Mark Townsend (@marktownsend1) on Feb 26, 2017 at 3:54pm PST

Most of the up-dos seen on the red carpet rely on several products and are virtually impossible to recreate at home on yourself. But for Dakota Johnson’s chic knotted half-up, half-down look, hairstylist Mark Townsend employed just two products: Dove’s Extra Hold Hairspray - this isn’t available in the UK, but Elnett is equally as good - and Scunci Hair Grips, £2.99. He simply twisted sections of the hair and pinned in place.   

The essential skin prep

Shower cap? @gucci hat, bien sur 😆Gift from my hubster 💋💋💋💋💋Face Mask perfection @repiderme from best facialist in LA #Lulurdayspa xxxx Thandie

A post shared by ThandieKay.com Instagram (@thandieandkay) on Feb 26, 2017 at 4:21pm PST

Sheet masks have been an Instagram favourite among celebrities for a couple of years now and last night Thandie Newton revealed her mask of choice. The actress posted a snap of her wearing a Repiderme sheet mask in the hours before the Oscars.

It's well known that hydrated skin looks fresher, plumper and firmer. For a similarly hydrating formula, look to Farmacy Hydrating Coconut Gel Mask, £8, and Erborian Bamboo Shot Mask, £6.

The sculpting self-tan tip

#blingedout #highlight for the #blingbling @jasonbolden put on @tarajiphenson contour with @sttropeztan and pumped up highlight with #enlightbydanessamyricks @danessa_myricks in #Halo cheek color @Glossier #CloudPaint #dusk brow @damoneroberts #minxpencil #peachbrowhighlightingpencil

A post shared by Ashunta Sheriff (@ashuntasheriff) on Feb 26, 2017 at 6:21pm PST

Make-up artist Ashunta Sheriff proved that there is more than one use for your self-tan. Sheriff used St Tropez Instant Tan Finishing Gloss, £12, to not only bronze, but also contour Taraji P. Henson’s decolletage and arms just before she hit the red carpet. “Taraji is a firm believer in ‘less is more’, so we didn’t want to overcomplicate or overthink anything,” Sheriff said. The gloss was applied where the light would naturally hit and is a great tip to employ if you want to enhance, or fake, sculpted limbs.

The classic lash secret

Oscar Glam with @heidiklum #makeup #LindaHay #hair @wendyiles_hair #Oscar #Oscars #glam #TWGartists ✨✨✨

A post shared by Linda Hay (@lindahaymakeup) on Feb 26, 2017 at 3:03pm PST

Whether you're layering on mascara or enlisting the help of false lashes, Heidi Klum proves that curling your natural lashes beforehand is imperative to ensuring they are red-carpet-worthy. Look to Surratt Relevee Lash Curler, £28, for stress-free curling thanks to the double-wired ergonomic design.
